name: Smyth Tavern
address: 85 W Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA

reviews.text: Marcella was amazing
Met a friend there. Food was excellent and the happy hour deal is really good. Great service and nice atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good place to eat.
Accommodated wonderfully though no reservations..always a pleasant experience from the front especially after a long day in the city
Awesome spot. Great burger, super high quality / fast Service. Very clean and new

Smyth Tavern located next door to the Smyth Hotel. Itâ€™s a nice upscale vibe but non pretentious. They have a really good happy hour with $7 beers and $12 cocktails. Their snacks are really good too. We sat at the bar and it was a nice experience. Would recommend for a quick bite and drink.

The Smyth has a very nice atmosphere with classy dÃ©cor. I recently spoke with management about organizing a a private event, and they were extremely helpful and supportive. They were also willing to explore different options to accommodate our needs, which I really appreciated. Overall, a great experience and highly recommended!

Smyth Tavern in Tribeca is such a gem! The restaurant has a really cute vibe with great ambiance perfect for a casual night out or even a date spot. I ordered the burger with truffle fries, and while my order initially came out wrong, the staff was incredibly apologetic and quick to fix it. They not only replaced my order right away but also brought out an extra order of fries with it, which I thought was such a thoughtful touch.

The food was delicious, the service was attentive, and the atmosphere makes you want to linger. Highly recommend this spot if youâ€™re in the area!
Really nice atmosphere. Great to grab a drink and a few bites. Host and servers are lovely and welcoming.

Smyth Tavern is a lovely American restaurant in Tribeca. They have a very well priced happy hour menu with food and drinks. The dinner menu is unfortunately a bit limited, but everything that we got was very good. The chicken paillard salad was delicious- the chicken was super thinly pounded, and there was lots of shaved parm on top. The campanelle alla vodka was amazing and came with fresh burrata on top. The burger and fries were also highly recommended. And the chocolate cake and hot fudge sundae for dessert were a must. The ambiance is cute and relaxing, and the service was good. The prices are in line with the area (which is on the higher side,) but definitely come for happy hour.
Great place to eat! Amazing customer service!!! Highly recommended!!

Popped in for a quick lunch and left extremely happy. Nice variety of food. My group split apps and sides, all generous portions of each. Tasty! Service was top notch too. Thanks for a great experience.

come here if you want really delicious food! everything is top notchâ€”we got the deviled eggs (oh so creamy and rich), a refreshing salad, Mac & Cheese (crafted to near perfection, especially the breadcrumbs), burger with fries was mouthwatering delicious, and the pasta dish with burrata is my favorite. Iâ€™m literally writing this review while waiting for dessert cuz this place is soooooo amazing. Must come when possible, and give it a try. The staff is so nice and welcoming. My girlfriend approves too.
I have to give this five stars, the first time we ate here was two years ago. And a little while ago we ate here again, it is an AMAZING place. Very kind staff, we will be back.
The food was fresh and tasty. The flavors were just right, and everything was cooked well. The place was clean, and the staff was friendly.
Smyth Tavern is a Tribeca Gem.  Great food, stellar service and charming vibe! Love it for breakfast, lunch and dinner!
Presi due piatti, entrambi non entusiasmanti (carne poco tenera e poco saporita). Buone le patatine fritte. Ambiente poco piacevole per lâ€™aria condizionata eccessivamente fredda.

The place was beautiful and definitely sophisticated.  the drinks were ok.  the food was delicious but what was amazing was the service. the staff (everyone.) was kind and welcoming.  definitely a most stop place.
A limited review since I had limited exposure. Tuna salad which was fine as was the meatball appetizer. Ambience fine. Service very good.  No alcohol. Prices, I thought, were on the high side.

I live in California. Visited this place last year with a friend and had the best brunch Iâ€™ve ever had. We talk about it all the time and cannot wait to get back to this place!! The folks who work there are really nice too <3
Great spot for a tuna niÃ§oise in TriBeCa. You can always find a table and the staff is incredibly friendly.

Great restaurant. Great food and super nice staff. I was walking around with my phone on 10% and asked if I could plug my phone charger in, the guy was more than happy to let me sit in a back table and plug my phone up at the server station.
The mimosa was light on OJ, which is the best, and the sandwich was amazing. It was what the McMuffin from McDonalds SHOULD be. The deviled eggs are the best thing ever. 10s 10s 10s.

DONâ€™T EVEN CONSIDER IT! Definitely a tourist trapâ€¦. We live in the area and just gave it a try for the first time. They charged us $28 for a Buffalo Trace Bourbon Whiskeyâ€¦. Yes, you saw it right, a simple American bourbon drink for $28!!! And on top of that, the Bar tender made us feel that he was doing us a favor to serve our drinks, not a very nice or service oriented employee. There are so many places in NY that this should be your last optionâ€¦.

The atmosphere is absolutely wonderful. Stopped in here before a reservation near by for a cocktail and loved the service and inside they have a fireplace which was so great on a cold evening. It's spacious and a great lounge feel. I had a negroni and it did not disappoint. Will definitely be back when in TriBeCa when I am thirsty.

Outstanding service. Our waiter Ishma was absolutely wonderful, so kind, sweet and had great recommendations. She made sure to take care of us with a food allergy. We will be back! Dawn was also fabulous. food is SO YUMMY.
Great service from Erik at the bar, delicious food, and nice atmosphere :)

Wonderful! The salmon was delicious! The sauce totally added to the salmon, the true art of cooking. The salmon melted in my mouth with a delicate explosion of flavor.

The salmon was the star of the entree, as it should be, with the potatoes and sting beans adding good quality and tasty additions.

The chicken soup had a robust flavor and was well made. The service was over the top, maybe because it was not too crowded. At least four different people checked in on me while dining. Every server was polite and professional. Dawn is very charming.
The place is extremely clean which I love as a cleanliness nut.

I had the lunch special which was the soup and salmon entree for $28. For this part of the city, during inflationary times seems like a good deal for a scrumptious lunch.

High quality food, pleasant atmosphere and great service!

I almost forgot, when I was finished with my meal the waitress brought over a complimentary chocolate chip cookie. Nice touch!

Returning to The Smyth Tavern in Tribeca after some time felt like a rediscovery of an old favorite. From the moment I walked in, the ambiance struck the perfect balance between casual and sophisticated. The window banquette seating adds a cozy touch, while the bar and back dining area provide a more refined atmosphere for a full dinner experience.
This visit was all about wine and appetizers with a friend, and we were in for a treat. We started with a bottle of rosÃ©, which set the tone for a relaxed evening. Our first appetizer, the Brussels sprouts with bacon, was an absolute standout. The crispy bacon and perfectly caramelized top layer of the sprouts added an irresistible crunch, making each bite a delight.
We also tried the deviled eggs;a classic dish, but I found the portion a bit small for the price, perhaps due to the rising cost of eggs. That said, they were still well-executed. The guacamole was fresh and enjoyable, though not the most memorable dish of the night.
The highlight of our meal was the crispy tuna, recommended by our wonderful waitress, Yolanda. She was charismatic and professional, effortlessly upselling us on the wine while also guiding us toward this incredible dish. The crunchy texture on top combined with the flavorful sauce made for an explosion of taste..an absolute must-try.
Another standout was the service. Dawn, the manager, was exceptional. She made her rounds, checking in on every table, ensuring that guests felt valued. Her warm and attentive approach elevated the entire experience.
Overall, The Smyth Tavern has certainly stepped up its game since my last visit. The food, atmosphere, and service were all top-notch. While some prices might feel a little high, the quality and experience more than justify it. Overall a 5 stars !
Everyone gave great service from the moment we walked in.  The food came out timely and spaced out perfectly. Great salad and the burger was tasty.  Would surely come back.

My wife, and friend and myself stopped by to get out of the cold and it turned out to be a great decision! Super nice atmosphere and kind staff. We hadnâ€™t heard of restaurant week but they participate and have a $30 lunch which is a great value. We each got an appetizer, an entree and a desert. Would definitely go back for dinner!

Staff was very friendly. Food was good. Serving size was not too big (we had lunch) everybody left satisfied without leaving behind a lot of food.  Ingredients were all fresh
I like it.
We were served by Paula, amazing service. A delightful and experienced cocktail bartender. Thanks Paula, you are the best in New York!
Very good food and friendly staff.
We had a great time here. We went for drinks and ate as well. Very enjoyable.
Went on a quiet night, the cocktails were good and it was a nice atmosphere.
What an amazing place to stop by and have a relaxed time. The food is amazing, staff is super friendly and kind. I highly recommend this place!

This place far exceded my expectations. As a single disabled person they understood my needs. No steps to climb and besides a bathroom on the lower level there's one on the restaurant level.
The place has a modern bohemian vibe. Tons of beautiful art work adorn the place. Plenty of Sepia and Black and White Photographs honoring NYC's many Water Tanks.
The Tavern is attached to and part of the Smyth Hotel which, in my opinion is very swank!
They had a special Thanksgiving Day Menu, I went traditional.
It's moderately priced.
Very easy to get there! Take the number 2 train to Chambers Street exit at the SE Corner and you're right at the front door, how convenient is that?
The Trade Tower is a short walking distance away.
I had a window seat that overlooked a Hopper Like Building.
I may go back for Christmas!
Very friendly staff and delicious drinks

Upon arrival this place seemed super cute and classy. I attended an event in the private dining room and the staff was nice but, this was by far the worst pasta I've ever ever had. There was no flavor whatsoever. They literally took pasta barely cooked it al dente and then threw string beans, asparagus, and mushrooms in it. No salt, no butter, no cheese, nothing.
Charged the tip twice, ridiculous
Steak was great, truffle fries even better

My husband and I dined at the restaurant and everything was absolutely fabulous. We started with the crab dumplings and both got the chicken paillard.  The service was great and the prices were on point for the neighborhood and extremely large portions.. Looking forward to coming back soon..
Muy ricos los desayunos ðŸ˜‹
Really recommend! Very good portions for the price and the staff was amazing
Excelente servicio de RubÃ©n y Neri
We came here for a team dinner, and we were all disappointed both with the service and the food.

My girlfriend and I came from Jersey and found this restaurant while we were visiting NY. It was very lovely and classy. Our server Tish was very polite and a great server to us the whole night, making the experience better. Overall great time!

My partner and I are from New Jersey and decided to explore today and try out some new restaurants. We came across Smyth Tavern and thought it seemed interesting, right away we were greeted by the kindest woman. Our server Tish was the sweetest soul, made us feel very comfortable and made great conversations with us. I can gladly say, we will be back !
Quick business lunch - quiet table and fast service. Food was good and served hot. Complimentary chocolate cookies was a highlight!!

Came into Smyth Tavern recently to grab some breakfast. The decor is like a diner but has touches that make it feel a bit homey.  It wasn't packed and I was able to be seated right away.

Yolanda was my server and was an absolute gem. She was able to accommodate me by grabbing the breakfast menu. I ordered an orange juice and a Belgian waffle with no Nutella (wasn't in the mood for sweets).

The orange juice tasted fresh, though the portion felt slightly small considering the $7 price tag. The waffle itself was enjoyable, especially with the addition of fresh berries. However, there was a slight delay in receiving the warm syrup I requested, and by the time it arrived, the waffle had cooled down.

In all, I can recommend Smyth Tavern for a breakfast date, or solo date. If you do go, ask for Yolanda! She is very attentive and accommodating!

The postcards with the bill were a nice touch!

Thank you for having me!

Stumbled upon this gem while looking for dinner without a reservation and was PLEASANTLY surprised from the moment we walked in! The lighting certainly set the mood for the moment to finally relax after a long workday and our waitress, Tish, took care of us til the moment we left. The food was delicious, ordered the burrata- heirloom tomato special and branzino st. tropez; as well as the drinks, got the Barbie cocktail. Tish also treated us to one of their amazing desserts, the chocolate 7 layer cake and freshly baked chocolate chip cookies ðŸ˜. Canâ€™t wait to go back!

Saw the pasta on Mike Chau's story and needed to try -- it tasted even better than it looked. The burger also looked delicious, but besides the sesame bun, it tasted pretty average, and wasn't serviced with anything other than ketchup;â€¦

As I walked in I was immediately cared for and brought right to my table. As I strolled through the restaurant the decor was breath taking and I felt like I was in a upscale modern tavern. As I began with the fried calamari it was delectable and I could not eat it fast enough. The service was absolutely thrilling. My water glass was always filled and the waiter left us with the perfect amount of time to make our food choices. I opted for the Bash Burger. My taste buds were absolutely tickled. I was left smiling and satisfied. I will definitely be dining at this fine establishment again very soon.

Itâ€™s such a shame a good kitchen is being let down by poor service. We took 8 guests to dinner and the food was good but it seemed like the servers had better things to do than look after us properly. They were pushy about taking orders befor we sipped our for cocktails then they didnâ€™t seem to understand starters come before main course the worst was our wine finally arrived after we had finished our main course.
Suddenly it made sense why the large dining room was empty, someone isnâ€™t paying attention to the service.
The wait staff seemed sweet but had little idea about good service. They should go intern up the street at Odeon.

Great spot for dinner or drinks in Tribeca! They recently opened up this restaurant in the Smyth Hotel. My husband and I made a rez for dinner and really enjoyed it.
For dinner we ordered the lobster pasta and lobster roll. Both delicious- the lobster pasta was our fav! Service was excellent- Brianna took care of us and she was great!! Highly recommend coming here for food and/or drinks.

I will start off by saying that the service here is good. They have a good team system going where everyone pitches in to assist. However the food was just okay in my opinion. It wasnt bad, but it also wasn't overly flavorful. I would go back again but maybe just for happy hour.
Beautiful room with great food options and an impressive bar selection of Spirits and Cocktails. Great place to meet Friends or to have a date night.
Nice vibe, especially enjoyed the bar area. Relatively small brunch menu, but the food was very good.

Went here for the first time last week and had the most incredible experience. It is such a cozy restaurant with a great atmosphere. The food was absolutely incredible, every single thing we ordered was amazing, cooked to perfection with delicious flavors. And what truly made the entire experience was the staff. The general manager was the kindest, sweetest, warm person and she's funny too! Our server, Janelle was also so so so great and also had the best personality and provided amazing service. From now on, every time I visit NYC I will not be missing the Smyth Tavern.
The chiken sandwich was great, I. Also tried the DONS PALOMA It was so refreshing an the matches with Grapefruit cinnamon and Vida Mezcal were interesting. Its a place that I will come back.

To start, our server Tish, certainly deserves a promotion. She went above and beyond to  set the tone for an unforgettable dinner. In our opinion she would be much better suited   in a higher capacity. Not only was she well versed on the entire wine list, she also recommended the best dinner dishes. To top it off, the added dessert was the cherry on top. She was charismatic, warm and welcoming. Thank you Tish for making our evening one to remember! - A&C

Wonderful dining experience! From the  great food to the exceptional service. My mom wanted an item from the dinner menu and was accommodated with the chef making sure it was to her liking. Tish@smythtavern provided exceptional service, Juan kept our water replenished and Dawn the manager made it extra special with her friendliness!! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a special afternoon dining experience ðŸ‘ðŸ»

We went to dinner at the Smyth Taven and had Tish. She was phenomenal and made this place feel so comfortable after a difficult travel day. She cleaned up our melting ice immediately to ensure we felt comfortable. She asked us several times if everything was to our liking and if she could provide better service. She worked hard to make us feel at home and did whatever was necessary to achieve this, such as providing new cutlery and napkins when dirtied. She was fantastic and would come again just for her.

We ate lunch at the Smyth last week. The restaurant itself is very comfortable with nice ambience, great music, and attentive service. However, the food was very disappointing. We ordered the broiled oysters with garlic breadcrumbs and the Smyth burger. The oysters were barely warm, had way too much breadcrumb topping and tasted like a mouthful of mush. We returned them. We ordered the burger medium rare and it arrived raw and cold in the middle. The waiter was very gracious about everything and took it back, but the new burger arrived medium. We ate it, but it wasn't anything special and it certainly wasn't medium rare.
The kitchen needs to get its act together. We certainly will not recommend it or eat there again.
